remarks: For any set-like well-ordered class, if the order isomorphism exists (is a set), then it maps some ordinal onto ` A ` isomorphically.  Otherwise, ` F ` is a proper class, which implies that either ` ran F C_ A ` is a proper class or ` dom F = On ` .  This weak version of ~ ordtype does not require the Axiom of Replacement.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2015.)
statement:
oicl.1 $e |- F = OrdIso ( R , A ) $.
ordtype2 $p |- ( ( R We A /\ R Se A /\ F e. _V ) -> F Isom _E , R ( dom F , A ) ) $.
